# Polished Notes (In Progress)

This series of notes on Methods in Political Science and Political Economics includes 3 sequences: Econometrics Sequence, Political Economics Sequence, and the Quantitative Methods Sequence.

**NOTE:** This is a work in progress, everything is incomplete.

<br />

### Econometric Methods

This series introduces econometric/statistical methods for analysing political phenomena empirically.

1.  [Volume I: Causal Inference and Regression](https://kevinli03.github.io/metrics/1.pdf). Topics inculde: causal estimands, random experiments, linear regression, logistic regression, regression for counts.
2.  [Volume II: Causal Estimation for Observational Studies](https://kevinli03.github.io/metrics/2.pdf). Topics include: selection on observables, instrumental variables estimator, differences-in-differences, regression discontinuity, survey experiments.
3.  [Volume III: Topics in Measurement](https://kevinli03.github.io/metrics/3.pdf). Topics include: principle components analysis, models for latent variables, cluster analysis, naive bayes, random forest, dictionary methods, structural equation models.

### Economic Modelling of Politics

This series introduces using economic theory to model political behaviour and institutions.

1.  [Volume I: Microeconomic Game Theory](https://kevinli03.github.io/polecon/1.pdf). Topics include: preferences and utility functions, pure and mixed nash equilibrium, dynamic games, bayesian games of incomplete information.
2.  [Volume II: Formal Models of Politics](https://kevinli03.github.io/polecon/2.pdf). Topics include:
3.  [Volume III: Advanced Game Theory](https://kevinli03.github.io/polecon/3.pdf). Topics include:

### Quantitative Methods

This companion series provides useful mathematical and statistical background knowledge. Volume I is highly recommended before starting any of the other series in these notes.

1.  [Volume I: Calculus and Statistical Theory](https://kevinli03.github.io/math/1.pdf). Topics include: algebra review, single variable calculus, basic probability theory, random variables.
2.  [Volume II: Linear Algebra and Multivariate Calculus](https://kevinli03.github.io/math/2.pdf). Topics include: matrices, system of linear equations, eigenvalues and markov chains, multivariate integration and differentiation.
3.  [Volume III: Proof and Analysis](https://kevinli03.github.io/math/5.pdf). Topics include:
